005package edu.wpi.first.math.estimator;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.math.MatBuilder;
008import edu.wpi.first.math.Matrix;
009import edu.wpi.first.math.Nat;
010import edu.wpi.first.math.StateSpaceUtil;
011import edu.wpi.first.math.VecBuilder;
012import edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Pose2d;
013import edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Rotation2d;
014import edu.wpi.first.math.kinematics.DifferentialDriveWheelSpeeds;
015import edu.wpi.first.math.numbers.N1;
016import edu.wpi.first.math.numbers.N3;
017import edu.wpi.first.math.numbers.N5;
018import edu.wpi.first.util.WPIUtilJNI;
019import java.util.function.BiConsumer;
020
021/**
022 * This class wraps an {@link edu.wpi.first.math.estimator.UnscentedKalmanFilter Unscented Kalman
023 * Filter} to fuse latency-compensated vision measurements with differential drive encoder
024 * measurements. It will correct for noisy vision measurements and encoder drift. It is intended to
025 * be an easy drop-in for {@link edu.wpi.first.math.kinematics.DifferentialDriveOdometry}; in fact,
026 * if you never call {@link DifferentialDrivePoseEstimator#addVisionMeasurement} and only call
027 * {@link DifferentialDrivePoseEstimator#update} then this will behave exactly the same as
028 * DifferentialDriveOdometry.
029 *
030 * <p>{@link DifferentialDrivePoseEstimator#update} should be called every robot loop (if your robot
031 * loops are faster than the default then you should change the {@link
032 * DifferentialDrivePoseEstimator#DifferentialDrivePoseEstimator(Rotation2d, Pose2d, Matrix, Matrix,
033 * Matrix, double) nominal delta time}.) {@link DifferentialDrivePoseEstimator#addVisionMeasurement}
034 * can be called as infrequently as you want; if you never call it then this class will behave
035 * exactly like regular encoder odometry.
036 *
037 * <p>Our state-space system is:
038 *
039 * <p><strong> x = [[x, y, theta, dist_l, dist_r]]ᵀ </strong> in the field coordinate system (dist_*
040 * are wheel distances.)
041 *
042 * <p><strong> u = [[vx, vy, omega]]ᵀ </strong> (robot-relative velocities) -- NB: using velocities
043 * make things considerably easier, because it means that teams don't have to worry about getting an
044 * accurate model. Basically, we suspect that it's easier for teams to get good encoder data than it
045 * is for them to perform system identification well enough to get a good model.
046 *
047 * <p><strong>y = [[x, y, theta]]ᵀ </strong> from vision, or <strong>y = [[dist_l, dist_r, theta]]
048 * </strong> from encoders and gyro.
049 */
050public class DifferentialDrivePoseEstimator {
051  final UnscentedKalmanFilter<N5, N3, N3> m_observer; // Package-private to allow for unit testing
052  private final BiConsumer<Matrix<N3, N1>, Matrix<N3, N1>> m_visionCorrect;
053  private final KalmanFilterLatencyCompensator<N5, N3, N3> m_latencyCompensator;
054
055  private final double m_nominalDt; // Seconds
056  private double m_prevTimeSeconds = -1.0;
057
058  private Rotation2d m_gyroOffset;
059  private Rotation2d m_previousAngle;
060
061  private Matrix<N3, N3> m_visionContR;
062
063  /**
064   * Constructs a DifferentialDrivePoseEstimator.
065   *
066   * @param gyroAngle The current gyro angle.
067   * @param initialPoseMeters The starting pose estimate.
068   * @param stateStdDevs Standard deviations of model states. Increase these numbers to trust your
069   *     model's state estimates less. This matrix is in the form [x, y, theta, dist_l, dist_r]ᵀ,
070   *     with units in meters and radians.
071   * @param localMeasurementStdDevs Standard deviations of the encoder and gyro measurements.
072   *     Increase these numbers to trust sensor readings from encoders and gyros less. This matrix
073   *     is in the form [dist_l, dist_r, theta]ᵀ, with units in meters and radians.
074   * @param visionMeasurementStdDevs Standard deviations of the vision measurements. Increase these
075   *     numbers to trust global measurements from vision less. This matrix is in the form [x, y,
076   *     theta]ᵀ, with units in meters and radians.
077   */
078  public DifferentialDrivePoseEstimator(
079      Rotation2d gyroAngle,
080      Pose2d initialPoseMeters,
081      Matrix<N5, N1> stateStdDevs,
082      Matrix<N3, N1> localMeasurementStdDevs,
083      Matrix<N3, N1> visionMeasurementStdDevs) {
084    this(
085        gyroAngle,
086        initialPoseMeters,
087        stateStdDevs,
088        localMeasurementStdDevs,
089        visionMeasurementStdDevs,
090        0.02);
091  }
092
093  /**
094   * Constructs a DifferentialDrivePoseEstimator.
095   *
096   * @param gyroAngle The current gyro angle.
097   * @param initialPoseMeters The starting pose estimate.
098   * @param stateStdDevs Standard deviations of model states. Increase these numbers to trust your
099   *     model's state estimates less. This matrix is in the form [x, y, theta, dist_l, dist_r]ᵀ,
100   *     with units in meters and radians.
101   * @param localMeasurementStdDevs Standard deviations of the encoder and gyro measurements.
102   *     Increase these numbers to trust sensor readings from encoders and gyros less. This matrix
103   *     is in the form [dist_l, dist_r, theta]ᵀ, with units in meters and radians.
104   * @param visionMeasurementStdDevs Standard deviations of the vision measurements. Increase these
105   *     numbers to trust global measurements from vision less. This matrix is in the form [x, y,
106   *     theta]ᵀ, with units in meters and radians.
107   * @param nominalDtSeconds The time in seconds between each robot loop.
108   */
109  @SuppressWarnings("ParameterName")
110  public DifferentialDrivePoseEstimator(
111      Rotation2d gyroAngle,
112      Pose2d initialPoseMeters,
113      Matrix<N5, N1> stateStdDevs,
114      Matrix<N3, N1> localMeasurementStdDevs,
115      Matrix<N3, N1> visionMeasurementStdDevs,
116      double nominalDtSeconds) {
117    m_nominalDt = nominalDtSeconds;
118
119    m_observer =
120        new UnscentedKalmanFilter<>(
121            Nat.N5(),
122            Nat.N3(),
123            this::f,
124            (x, u) -> VecBuilder.fill(x.get(3, 0), x.get(4, 0), x.get(2, 0)),
125            stateStdDevs,
126            localMeasurementStdDevs,
127            AngleStatistics.angleMean(2),
128            AngleStatistics.angleMean(2),
129            AngleStatistics.angleResidual(2),
130            AngleStatistics.angleResidual(2),
131            AngleStatistics.angleAdd(2),
132            m_nominalDt);
133    m_latencyCompensator = new KalmanFilterLatencyCompensator<>();
134
135    // Initialize vision R
136    setVisionMeasurementStdDevs(visionMeasurementStdDevs);
137
138    m_visionCorrect =
139        (u, y) ->
140            m_observer.correct(
141                Nat.N3(),
142                u,
143                y,
144                (x, u1) -> new Matrix<>(x.getStorage().extractMatrix(0, 3, 0, 1)),
145                m_visionContR,
146                AngleStatistics.angleMean(2),
147                AngleStatistics.angleResidual(2),
148                AngleStatistics.angleResidual(2),
149                AngleStatistics.angleAdd(2));
150
151    m_gyroOffset = initialPoseMeters.getRotation().minus(gyroAngle);
152    m_previousAngle = initialPoseMeters.getRotation();
153    m_observer.setXhat(fillStateVector(initialPoseMeters, 0.0, 0.0));
154  }
155
156  /**
157   * Sets the pose estimator's trust of global measurements. This might be used to change trust in
158   * vision measurements after the autonomous period, or to change trust as distance to a vision
159   * target increases.
160   *
161   * @param visionMeasurementStdDevs Standard deviations of the vision measurements. Increase these
162   *     numbers to trust global measurements from vision less. This matrix is in the form [x, y,
163   *     theta]ᵀ, with units in meters and radians.
164   */
165  public void setVisionMeasurementStdDevs(Matrix<N3, N1> visionMeasurementStdDevs) {
166    m_visionContR = StateSpaceUtil.makeCovarianceMatrix(Nat.N3(), visionMeasurementStdDevs);
167  }
168
169  @SuppressWarnings({"ParameterName", "MethodName"})
170  private Matrix<N5, N1> f(Matrix<N5, N1> x, Matrix<N3, N1> u) {
171    // Apply a rotation matrix. Note that we do *not* add x--Runge-Kutta does that for us.
172    var theta = x.get(2, 0);
173    var toFieldRotation =
174        new MatBuilder<>(Nat.N5(), Nat.N5())
175            .fill(
176                Math.cos(theta),
177                -Math.sin(theta),
178                0,
179                0,
180                0,
181                Math.sin(theta),
182                Math.cos(theta),
183                0,
184                0,
185                0,
186                0,
187                0,
188                1,
189                0,
190                0,
191                0,
192                0,
193                0,
194                1,
195                0,
196                0,
197                0,
198                0,
199                0,
200                1);
201    return toFieldRotation.times(
202        VecBuilder.fill(u.get(0, 0), u.get(1, 0), u.get(2, 0), u.get(0, 0), u.get(1, 0)));
203  }
204
205  /**
206   * Resets the robot's position on the field.
207   *
208   * <p>You NEED to reset your encoders (to zero) when calling this method.
209   *
210   * <p>The gyroscope angle does not need to be reset here on the user's robot code. The library
211   * automatically takes care of offsetting the gyro angle.
212   *
213   * @param poseMeters The position on the field that your robot is at.
214   * @param gyroAngle The angle reported by the gyroscope.
215   */
216  public void resetPosition(Pose2d poseMeters, Rotation2d gyroAngle) {
217    // Reset state estimate and error covariance
218    m_observer.reset();
219    m_latencyCompensator.reset();
220
221    m_observer.setXhat(fillStateVector(poseMeters, 0.0, 0.0));
222
223    m_gyroOffset = getEstimatedPosition().getRotation().minus(gyroAngle);
224    m_previousAngle = poseMeters.getRotation();
225  }
226
227  /**
228   * Gets the pose of the robot at the current time as estimated by the Unscented Kalman Filter.
229   *
230   * @return The estimated robot pose in meters.
231   */
232  public Pose2d getEstimatedPosition() {
233    return new Pose2d(
234        m_observer.getXhat(0), m_observer.getXhat(1), new Rotation2d(m_observer.getXhat(2)));
235  }
236
237  /**
238   * Add a vision measurement to the Unscented Kalman Filter. This will correct the odometry pose
239   * estimate while still accounting for measurement noise.
240   *
241   * <p>This method can be called as infrequently as you want, as long as you are calling {@link
242   * DifferentialDrivePoseEstimator#update} every loop.
243   *
244   * @param visionRobotPoseMeters The pose of the robot as measured by the vision camera.
245   * @param timestampSeconds The timestamp of the vision measurement in seconds. Note that if you
246   *     don't use your own time source by calling {@link
247   *     DifferentialDrivePoseEstimator#updateWithTime} then you must use a timestamp with an epoch
248   *     since FPGA startup (i.e. the epoch of this timestamp is the same epoch as
249   *     Timer.getFPGATimestamp.) This means that you should use Timer.getFPGATimestamp as your time
250   *     source in this case.
251   */
252  public void addVisionMeasurement(Pose2d visionRobotPoseMeters, double timestampSeconds) {
253    m_latencyCompensator.applyPastGlobalMeasurement(
254        Nat.N3(),
255        m_observer,
256        m_nominalDt,
257        StateSpaceUtil.poseTo3dVector(visionRobotPoseMeters),
258        m_visionCorrect,
259        timestampSeconds);
260  }
261
262  /**
263   * Add a vision measurement to the Unscented Kalman Filter. This will correct the odometry pose
264   * estimate while still accounting for measurement noise.
265   *
266   * <p>This method can be called as infrequently as you want, as long as you are calling {@link
267   * DifferentialDrivePoseEstimator#update} every loop.
268   *
269   * <p>Note that the vision measurement standard deviations passed into this method will continue
270   * to apply to future measurements until a subsequent call to {@link
271   * DifferentialDrivePoseEstimator#setVisionMeasurementStdDevs(Matrix)} or this method.
272   *
273   * @param visionRobotPoseMeters The pose of the robot as measured by the vision camera.
274   * @param timestampSeconds The timestamp of the vision measurement in seconds. Note that if you
275   *     don't use your own time source by calling {@link
276   *     DifferentialDrivePoseEstimator#updateWithTime} then you must use a timestamp with an epoch
277   *     since FPGA startup (i.e. the epoch of this timestamp is the same epoch as
278   *     Timer.getFPGATimestamp.) This means that you should use Timer.getFPGATimestamp as your time
279   *     source in this case.
280   * @param visionMeasurementStdDevs Standard deviations of the vision measurements. Increase these
281   *     numbers to trust global measurements from vision less. This matrix is in the form [x, y,
282   *     theta]ᵀ, with units in meters and radians.
283   */
284  public void addVisionMeasurement(
285      Pose2d visionRobotPoseMeters,
286      double timestampSeconds,
287      Matrix<N3, N1> visionMeasurementStdDevs) {
288    setVisionMeasurementStdDevs(visionMeasurementStdDevs);
289    addVisionMeasurement(visionRobotPoseMeters, timestampSeconds);
290  }
291
292  /**
293   * Updates the the Unscented Kalman Filter using only wheel encoder information. Note that this
294   * should be called every loop.
295   *
296   * @param gyroAngle The current gyro angle.
297   * @param wheelVelocitiesMetersPerSecond The velocities of the wheels in meters per second.
298   * @param distanceLeftMeters The total distance travelled by the left wheel in meters since the
299   *     last time you called {@link DifferentialDrivePoseEstimator#resetPosition}.
300   * @param distanceRightMeters The total distance travelled by the right wheel in meters since the
301   *     last time you called {@link DifferentialDrivePoseEstimator#resetPosition}.
302   * @return The estimated pose of the robot in meters.
303   */
304  public Pose2d update(
305      Rotation2d gyroAngle,
306      DifferentialDriveWheelSpeeds wheelVelocitiesMetersPerSecond,
307      double distanceLeftMeters,
308      double distanceRightMeters) {
309    return updateWithTime(
310        WPIUtilJNI.now() * 1.0e-6,
311        gyroAngle,
312        wheelVelocitiesMetersPerSecond,
313        distanceLeftMeters,
314        distanceRightMeters);
315  }
316
317  /**
318   * Updates the the Unscented Kalman Filter using only wheel encoder information. Note that this
319   * should be called every loop.
320   *
321   * @param currentTimeSeconds Time at which this method was called, in seconds.
322   * @param gyroAngle The current gyro angle.
323   * @param wheelVelocitiesMetersPerSecond The velocities of the wheels in meters per second.
324   * @param distanceLeftMeters The total distance travelled by the left wheel in meters since the
325   *     last time you called {@link DifferentialDrivePoseEstimator#resetPosition}.
326   * @param distanceRightMeters The total distance travelled by the right wheel in meters since the
327   *     last time you called {@link DifferentialDrivePoseEstimator#resetPosition}.
328   * @return The estimated pose of the robot in meters.
329   */
330  @SuppressWarnings({"LocalVariableName", "ParameterName"})
331  public Pose2d updateWithTime(
332      double currentTimeSeconds,
333      Rotation2d gyroAngle,
334      DifferentialDriveWheelSpeeds wheelVelocitiesMetersPerSecond,
335      double distanceLeftMeters,
336      double distanceRightMeters) {
337    double dt = m_prevTimeSeconds >= 0 ? currentTimeSeconds - m_prevTimeSeconds : m_nominalDt;
338    m_prevTimeSeconds = currentTimeSeconds;
339
340    var angle = gyroAngle.plus(m_gyroOffset);
341    // Diff drive forward kinematics:
342    // v_c = (v_l + v_r) / 2
343    var wheelVels = wheelVelocitiesMetersPerSecond;
344    var u =
345        VecBuilder.fill(
346            (wheelVels.leftMetersPerSecond + wheelVels.rightMetersPerSecond) / 2,
347            0,
348            angle.minus(m_previousAngle).getRadians() / dt);
349    m_previousAngle = angle;
350
351    var localY = VecBuilder.fill(distanceLeftMeters, distanceRightMeters, angle.getRadians());
352    m_latencyCompensator.addObserverState(m_observer, u, localY, currentTimeSeconds);
353    m_observer.predict(u, dt);
354    m_observer.correct(u, localY);
355
356    return getEstimatedPosition();
357  }
358
359  private static Matrix<N5, N1> fillStateVector(Pose2d pose, double leftDist, double rightDist) {
360    return VecBuilder.fill(
361        pose.getTranslation().getX(),
362        pose.getTranslation().getY(),
363        pose.getRotation().getRadians(),
364        leftDist,
365        rightDist);
366  }
367}
